name: coyness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour in which someone intentionally tries to keep something secret: The unwritten rules of political conduct demand a certain coyness. He commented on their coyness about revealing the thinking behind those decisions.
behaviour in which someone is or pretends to be shy, or like a child: Marie seems to know exactly what effect her coyness has on men. "I'd love to come out with you," Melanie said, without the slightest coyness.
More examplesFewer examplesHis coyness about his future political intentions prompted a TV news anchor to ask the politician's wife the question on everyone's lips. A certain coyness shrouds the enterprise.Feigning coyness, she fluttered her lashes.The extreme shyness he encountered when they were dating was not coyness.
